info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 14 at 3:43PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southern Nevada, including the following county, Clark. Boulder City and Lakeshore Road is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. * WHEN...Until 645 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 341 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in Boulder City and Lakeshore Road. Between 0.25 and 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Boulder City and Lakeshore Road is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Boulder City, Las Vegas Bay, Railroad Pass, Boulder Beach Campground, Hoover Dam, Boulder Beach, Las Vegas Bay Campground and Willow Beach. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
